result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexander T Klawitter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.  Zero credit for time served.  Sentence shall run consecutive to any other sentence

miscConds.notes: Restitution Information attached.    If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. Clerk of Courts shall docket without fees. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

No use or possession of controlled substances, unless prescribed by a physician.   No possession of drug paraphernalia.  No intoxicants.  Do not enter establishment where primary purpose is sale of alcohol.  No contact with Dennis Schuhart.

Complete compas assessment,  counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate and followup.  Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections and follow rules of supervision.  Defendant shall Maintain Absolute Sobriety.  Defendant shall Submit to Random Urinalysis.  Submit DNA sample.  Defendant shall comply with mental health assessment and counseling as deemed appropriate.

timeConds.notes: consecutive with zero credit and NO GOOD TIME.  NO HUBER FOR FIRST 3 MONTHS, THEN HUBER ALLOWED.  Huber granted, if in compliance with jail facility regulations.
